conclusion: Analyze the flow pattern to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are rectangular shapes with red arrows pointing towards them, designed to direct the flow of the liquid.
The liquid starts at point A and flows through the baffles.
At point A, the liquid flows out.
At point B, the liquid flows through the baffles and then out.
At point C, the liquid flows through the baffles and then out.
The liquid flows out of container D.
The liquid flows through the baffles and then out of container E.
The liquid will flow out of container D after passing through the baffles.
